mobs.LongDesc: A small rat.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This rat doesn't look any different than all the other rats you have ever
seen. It is small, filthy, and sitting in it's own feces.

mobs.LongDesc: A giant rat.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This rat has been mutated by warpstone. It is very large. It stands a good
two feet off of the ground, and is a good four or five feet long. It's eyes
seem to glow with an unnatural evil.

mobs.LongDesc: An adolescent rat ogre.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Before you stands a huge rat like ogre. Through the twisted mutating effect
of warpstone, and the ingenious breeding procedures of the Skaven packmasters
they have managed to get a near perfect mix of a rat and an ogre. It has the
brutish strength of an ogre, the lightning reflexes of a rat, and the razor
sharp teeth and claws of a Skaven. You are glad the packmaster isn't in this
pen to order this beast to attack you.

mobs.LongDesc: A gutter runner is here, training to be an assassin.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This Skaven is dressed in dark trousers. He is wearing only a vest on his
body, and has an array of weapons about him. He is currently trying to survive
the Circle of Assassins. If he survives, he will be promoted to a Clan Eshin
assassin. If he doesn't survive, he may get fed to the Clan Moulder rat ogres,
if the assassin who kills him doesn't eat him first that is...

mobs.LongDesc: A Clan Eshin assassin is here lurking in the shadows.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Once you have laid eyes on a Clan Eshin assassin, you have sealed your fate.
These Skaven are more talented than ANYONE at the art of stealthy murder.
If Clan Eshin has you as a target you can forget about seeing tomorrow...

mobs.LongDesc: Deathmaster Snikch, Chief Assassin of Clan Eshin, is here.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Snikch is the most elite killer known. His background is shrouded in mystery.
Perhaps the only thing more mysterious than his background, is his wherabouts
at any given time. Lord Sneek, the Skaven Nightlord and member of the council
of Thirteen, likes to keep the wherabouts of his pet killer, Snikch, a total
mystery at all times.

mobs.LongDesc: A Clan Skryre Warlock engineer is here, tinkering with technology.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Engineers are the lowest rank of Clan Skryre Warlocks. They are the beginning
of the Skaven magic users. Though they may be the least trained in the ways
of magic, their ambitions are usually enough to get them through most battles.
If they can survive long enough, thay may someday become a Warlock Master,
and maybe, if they are VERY lucky, a Grey Seer.

mobs.LongDesc: A Clan Skryre Warlock Champion waits to kill you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Warlock champions are one step up from Warlock engineers. They have proven
they have the magical abilities to advance in the Clan Skryre echelon. Theirs
is the trusted task of helping the Warlock Masters bring their diabolical
new devices to fruition by overseeing the construction and testing of such
devices. Unfortunately not many champions make it past this stage because
they are usually killed by some testing procedure. This is perhaps in the
best interest of the Warlock Master who authorized the testing, and is 
nothing more than the Skaven way...

mobs.LongDesc: A Clan Skryre Warlock master prepares to blast you with a potent spell.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Warlock masters are as high as is possible to attain in the Clan Skryre
echelon. They have mastered the art of magic use in all it's Skaven forms.
They only await backing by either a Lord of Decay, or a Grey Seer. If they
receive such backing, they will then themselves be promoted to the lofty
position of Grey Seer, and will be as independant of the law as is possible
for any Skaven, saving the Council of Thirteen.

mobs.LongDesc: A Skaven Grey Seer is here, testing the winds of magic.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Grey Seers are the ultimate magic users in Skaven society. Their purpose is
to uphold and defend the Council of Thirteen, although many ambitious Grey
Seers seek to unseat various members of the Council of Thirteen (this is
highly unlikely though as the current members of the Council have occupied
their positions for many centuries.

mobs.LongDesc: Ikit Claw, Chief Warlock of Clan Skryre grins evilly.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Ikit Claw is one of the most powerful sorcerers in the Old World, being
second in power only to Teclis, the High Elf mage. Ikit has dedicated his
life to the study of all forms of magery, including the spells of men, Elves
and Orcs. Ikit is tall and white-furred, always a sign of distinction and
power amongst the Skaven. His face and arm were badly burned during a failed
experiment long ago. He has constructed an intricate mask to cover his 
mutilated and hairless skull, and a cunningly-made skeletal claw of iron, 
crystal, and brass to give strength to his withered arm.

mobs.LongDesc: Thazartak, Skaven Warlock Master of Clan Skryre is here.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Thazartak is one of the most powerful Warlock masters. He is of the same
birthing as the Skaven Grey Seer Thanquol. His ambition is undisguised, as
the 22 failed assassination attempts on Thanquol make obvious. He despises
Thanquol and will stop at nothing to replace him as the Council of Thirteen's
pet Grey Seer.

mobs.LongDesc: A Clan Skryre warpfire team is here, shooting flames at you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This team consists of two Skaven. One is carrying a huge barrel of chemicals
on his back, while the other wields a hugr nozzle which is attacked to the
barrel by a hose. The nozzle is spouting a green looking flame. I would
not suggest getting to close to the flames...

mobs.LongDesc: A Clan Skryre jezzail team aims at your head.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
A jezzail team consists of two skaven wielding a huge rifle. One Skaven holds
a stick upon which the other Skaven rests the end of the barrel. The jezzail
itself is a rather large gun capable of punching holes in heavy armor with
relative ease.

mobs.LongDesc: a Skaven-giant is rampaging about here.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
What is this horror? This creature looks like it has been stiched together
from the pieces of a Skaven and a giant. If there were such a creature in
the Old World as Frankensteins monster, this would be it. It even appears
to have been animated from the dead through science.

mobs.LongDesc: An immense albino guard of the Council of Thirteen is here, guarding his key.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This Skaven is huge in comparison to other Skaven you have seen. His fur is
also the purest white. You are not sure whether his skin color and size are
the result of magic, mutation, breeding, or just natural.

mobs.LongDesc: An albino guard is here, guarding the gates.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This Skaven is huge in comparison to other Skaven you have seen. His fur is
also the purest white. You are not sure whether his skin color and size are
the result of magic, mutation, breeding, or just natural.

mobs.LongDesc: An albino guard is here, guarding the gates.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This Skaven is huge in comparison to other Skaven you have seen. His fur is
also the purest white. You are not sure whether his skin color and size are
the result of magic, mutation, breeding, or just natural.

mobs.LongDesc: A Clan Eshin Assassin guard is here keeping the unprepared out.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This Skaven has jet black fur. In this dark tunnel it is hard to even make
out anything about him because the color of his fur helps him blend into the
darkness.

mobs.LongDesc: A Skaven is here, watching the fighting below.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This Skaven is watching the fighting taking place in the Clan Mors Arena. Like
all Skaven, he looks more akin to a rat than to a human, but it is hard to 
tell for sure. Anyways he seems to be very proccupied by the contests below.

mobs.LongDesc: A Skaven Clanrat warrior is here, ready to fight.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The Clanrat warriors are drwan from the Warlord clans and are the mainstay
of any Skaven army. In battle they form up into vast chittering hordes which
overwhelm the foe in a terrifying avalanche of insane rat-warriors. Individual
Clanrats are vicious, but can be ill disciplined and cowardly. In large packs
they become fanatically over-confident and well-nigh unstoppable.

mobs.LongDesc: A black-furred Stormvermin is here, wanting to kill you!!!
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The Stormvermin are the hand-picked warrior elite of the Clanrat hordes.
Stormvermin are much larger than ordinary Clanrats and many have black fur.
For this reason, black-furred Skaven have a reputation for being killers, 
and are much feared amongst the Clanrats.

mobs.LongDesc: Warlord Queek Head-Taker is here, looking quite impressive!!
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Warlord Queek Head-Taker is the right claw of Warlord Gnawdwell, the ruler of
Clan Mors and the City of Pillars. His vitriolic temper and immense ego are
well known among the Skaven and greatly admired. He takes pleasure in 
challenging opposing leaders and heros to single combat and slaying them. The
severed heads on Queek's trophy rack are kept as momentoes of the more
challenging fights, making him an unmistakable sight on the battle field, his
collection includes the head of Krug Ironhand of Karak Drazh, Ikit Slash of
Fester Spike, and the hands of Albrecht Kraus.

mobs.LongDesc: A captured minotaur warrior is here, far away from Mahn Tor.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
You see a huge minotaur that is wearing the robes of a slave. He has black
fur and red eyes. He look formidable even in the robes of a slave.

mobs.LongDesc: A huge and incredibly ugly ogre glowers at you stupidly.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This is an ogre captured from the magical land of Xanth. The Skaven love to
watch a good fight and will go to just about any land to get a worthy opponent.

mobs.LongDesc: An orc is here, along way away from Moria.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This orc has been dragged from the mines of Moria, to this arena in
Skavenblight. Here he will be forced to fight day after day until he finally
dies at the hands of either a Clan Mors trainee, or some other poor creature
captured by the Skaven.

mobs.LongDesc: A Skaven slave is here, looking quite pitiful.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Skaven slaves are the dregs of Skaven society, slaves too unskilled or stupid
to be put to work in the mines or forges. Nearly all Skavenslaves are from
Clans which have been defeated and enslaved in intercine Clan warfare.

mobs.LongDesc: A Clan Moulder Packmaster is looking for some warpstone.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Clan Moulder is one of the smallest Clans in numbers but controls a large
amount of warpstone which it uses to create new and ever more dangerous
creatures. The Packmasters are the one to whom is given the responsiblity of
training these creatures, as well as controlling them in the heat of battle.

mobs.LongDesc: A Rat Ogre towers above you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Rat Ogres are the most feared of all the Clan Moulder's mutant beasts. Rat
Ogres are huge, Skaven-like creatures the size and strength of true Ogres,
but possessed of the speed and ferocity of Skaven. A Rat Ogre's small brain
is devoted entirely to fighting and bloodshed, so in battle units of Rat Ogres
are controlled by Clan Moulder Packmasters who direct the monsters and unleash
their devastating charges when the time is right.

mobs.LongDesc: Throt the Unclean Skaven Packmaster of Clan Moulder is training some Rat Ogres.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Throt the Unclean is one of Clan Moulder's strongest Packmasters. His rise
through the ranks of Clan Moulder has been carefully watched by agents of
Lord Verminkin, though whether he intends to reward or destroy him remains to
be seen. Throt is a fearsome fighter renowned for his fantastic strength.
As well as his steel-hard muscles, Thro has been blessed with the mutation of
a third arm since his birthing and has learned to wield a sword and a man-
catcher together with deadly skill. Throt lost an eye in his last fight with
a rival Packmaster and has had it replaced with a glowing warpstone charm,
making him look wierder than ever.

mobs.LongDesc: A Clan Pestilens Plague Censer Bearer is waving his censer around.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The most fanatical and deranged members of Clan Pestilens are given the
singular honor of wielding a plague censer. As the Plague Monks march into
battle they are preceded by a loose group of Plague Censer Bearers who pollute
the air with foul fumes. Swinging their censers, the bearers swarm forward
to the chanted accompaniment of the Liturgus Infecticus.

mobs.LongDesc: A Clan Pestilens Plague Monk is spreading disease.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The Plague Monks are a devout order which have dedicated themselves utterly
to the spreading of corruption and decay in the name of the Horned Rat. They
are the initiates of infection and the disciples of disease. In battle Plague
Monk regiments hurl themselves into the fray with fanatical ferocity, eager
to bring death and destruction to their foes.

mobs.LongDesc: A Clan Pestilens Plague Priest is speading disease here.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Plague Priests are among the foulest and most degenerate ratmen in the rotting
brotherhood of the diciples of decay. They command all the other Clan Pestilens
members (with the exception of both Skrolk and Nurglitch).

mobs.LongDesc: Lord Skrolk, Plaguelord of Clan Pestilens is eyeing you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Lord Skrolk is very old an unutterably evil. By the blessing of the Horned
Rat he has lived many times his ordinary lifespan and unleashed unspeakable
woes upon the world of men. At the beginning of his life Skrolk was a simple
Plague Monk, but his devotion to the Horned Rat drew him up to the long
struggle for power which eventually led him to Skavenblight to offer his
services to Nurglitch, the seventh Arch-Plaguelord. Nurglitch-who-is-seventh
set him many long and arduous trials, including traversing the insanely
dangerous Blindwyrm Labyrinth beneath Clan Pestilens' hold in Lustria. Sucess
came to Skrolk in all things.

mobs.LongDesc: Arch-Plaguelord Nurglitch of Clan Pestilens is rotting here.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Nurglitch is the highest ranking Clan Pestilens you can ever achieve. He now
has no healthy cell left in his entire body. He might almost be considered a
living dead, except his cells still live, they are just infested and rotting.

mobs.LongDesc: Lord Morskittar of Clan Skryre is devising some fiendish contraption.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Lord Morksittar is the head of Clan Skryre. Clan Skryre focuses on making
the most destrutive devices. Their past successes include the Doom Wheel,
the jezzail, the warpfire thrower, and the all too feared Screaming Bell
Tower. You can beleive that Morskittar is right now working on a more 
destructive, if not effective, way to kill you.

mobs.LongDesc: Lord Verminkin, the leader of Clan Moulder, waits to destroy you.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Lord Verminkin is the highest ranking Skaven in the Clan Moulder. Moulder
specializes in mutating creatures through careful breeding processes and
exposure to warpstone. Lord Verminkin oversaw the creation of the infamous
Rat Ogres. He surely has the power to call help to his side when needed.

mobs.LongDesc:
Lord Sneek, Lord of Decay and Nightlord of Clan Eshin lurks in the shadows
here.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Lord Sneek is one of the most feared Skaven ever. While he is not as good at
the art of subtle killing as his pet killer, Snikch, the very fact that he
commands Snikch's every move makes him even more fearsome. He has been on the
Council of Thirteen for a very long time and is only slightly less adept at
the art of murder than Snikch.

mobs.LongDesc: Lord Gnawdwell, Chief Warlord and residing member of the Council of Thirteen is here.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Warlord Gnawdwell is probably the most skilled fighter among the Skaven. He
might have a hard time killing Snikch, or Sneek, but when it comes to open
battle, where your enemy is seen, Gnawdwell shines. He has practiced every
form of fighting known to man and some that have been kept secret from man.

mobs.LongDesc: Master Sleekit, the Grey Seer of the Council is researching some spells.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Sleekit is the current residing Grey Seer on the Council of Thirteen. He
inherited the position after an aweseome duel with, Kritislik, the Grey Seer
who formerly occupied the position. Sleekit trained Thanquol and now uses him
as his little pet magician.

mobs.LongDesc: Cleric-Lord Velasque is learning how to keep his Skaven alive in battle.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Velasque has occupied his Council position for several centuries. There is
some speculation as to whether this is due to the blessing of the Horned Rat,
or because Velasque himself studies the art of healing and the preservation
of life (a fact that has made the other Skaven to think he somewhat less of
a Skaven).

mobs.LongDesc: Lord Paskrit is here, observing the stars.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Lord Paskrit is one of the original twelve council members. He is so old that
he has devised a way to understand the future by looking at the stars. So here
in his observatory, Paskrit sits and observes the stars to see what might 
happen. Does he see your death in the near future?

mobs.LongDesc: Skritisqueel is here, thinking of a way to further the Skaven causes.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Skritisqueel is the most intelligent of all Skaven. When the Skaven have a 
problem they cannot figure out, they seek out Skritisqueel. Whil he would
much rather spend his time considering the mysteries of the universe, and
not be bothered by the petty intrigues of the Skaven wars, he also knows
that if he wishes to maintain the blessing of the Horned Rat he must do what
he can to help his fellow Skaven out.

mobs.LongDesc: Lord Vasque is here, cataloging some documents.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Lord Vasque has been on the council so long that his main concerc is to keep
a written account of all Skaven history. He remembers things that no other
Skaven, with the exception of a few council members, do. This is what he does
all day long, and he seems to enjoy it immensely. How odd for a Skaven...

mobs.LongDesc: Lord Rakscree is here, getting ready to kill you!!!
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Nothing much is known about Lord Rakscree, except that he is possibly the
most mysterious of all Skaven (with the exception of maybe Sneek and Snikch).
All that is know about Rakscree is the rumors which circulate after some poor
Skaven has been made to see him face to face...and was never seen again.

mobs.LongDesc: Lord Thraskin is pondering some concept here.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Lord Thraskin is a very old and very evil Skaven. He is one of the few residing
members who was there when the Horned Rat created the Thirteen Sided Pillar.
While he was not one of the first members of the council, various events have
brought about his rise to the council, and he is now considered one of the
most reverred members of the council.

mobs.LongDesc: The Horned Rat towers above you like a monolith!!!
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The Horned Rat is the Skaven god. He was born out of the Chaos void, and 
loves nothing more than chaos personified. He stands a good twenty-five feet
tall, looks alot like a Skaven, except that he has hoofed feet and horns on his
head. He does not look like someone you would like to mess with at all.

mobs.LongDesc: Boneripper, Thanquols personal body guard, is here, looking for Thanquol.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Boneripper was given to Thanquol by the Council of Thirteen after he failed
to destroy the city of Nuln. His failed attempt however, resulted in wiping
out the Skaven warriors of Clan Skab, who had planned a revolt against the
Council. This coupled with the fact that half of the city of Nuln was
destroyed, prompted the Council to reward Thanquol with a Rat Ogre who had
been mutated by Clan Moulder to have three arms. Thanquol was so pleased with
his luck that he named the Rat Ogre Boneripper, after his former Rat Ogre
body guard who died at the hands of Gotrek, during the failed attempt to
destroy Nuln.

mobs.LongDesc: A Skaven Chieftan of Clan Mors is training here.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Chieftans are powerful indivuals who have fought their way up through the
ranks of the Skaven to become the lieutenants of a great Warlord.

mobs.LongDesc: A Skaven Warlord General is here, training his troops.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
A General is a powerful Clanrat Warlord who has either been given direct
command of an army by order of the Council of Thirteen or is undertaking a
conquest as part of his own private schemes.

mobs.LongDesc: A Skaven Champion of Clan Mors is here.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This Skaven doesn't look much different than the other Skaven you have seen
here in the Clan Mors Arena. He is most likely an especially powerful or
adept Skaven warrior, hence the title Champion.

mobs.LongDesc: A Clan Skryre Doomwheel rumbles ominously toward you!!!
mobs.DetailedDesc:
The Doomwheel was designed by the mad genius Ikit Claw. It consists of a 
huge wheel which is steered by a smaller wheel in the back of this fiendish
contraption. Within the larger of the wheels are six giant rats which are
fed a stimulant drug, and driven into an insane frenzy by the lightning
flashing and sparking around them. As they tumple over each other the wheel
rumbles forward steadily, but inconsistantly. Their movements also power the
huge warp generators within the wheel's chasis. With three huge metal claws
protruding from the front and both sides, the generators unleash their
dreadful warplightning when the Warlock Engineer throws the switch, lashing
out at the nearest target, be they friend or foe.

mobs.LongDesc: A chaos spawn.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This creature is a spawn of the swirling energies of chaos itself. There
is no real way to describe it except to say that it hates any and everything.
It will attack randomly and regardless of race.

mobs.LongDesc: An immense albino guard of the Council of Thirteen is here, guarding his key.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This Skaven is huge in comparison to other Skaven you have seen. His fur is
also the purest white. You are not sure whether his skin color and size are
the result of magic, mutation, breeding, or just natural.

mobs.LongDesc: An immense albino guard of the Council of Thirteen is here, guarding his key.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This Skaven is huge in comparison to other Skaven you have seen. His fur is
also the purest white. You are not sure whether his skin color and size are
the result of magic, mutation, breeding, or just natural.

mobs.LongDesc: An immense albino guard of the Council of Thirteen is here, guarding his key.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This Skaven is huge in comparison to other Skaven you have seen. His fur is
also the purest white. You are not sure whether his skin color and size are
the result of magic, mutation, breeding, or just natural.

mobs.LongDesc: An immense albino guard of the Council of Thirteen is here, guarding his key.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This Skaven is huge in comparison to other Skaven you have seen. His fur is
also the purest white. You are not sure whether his skin color and size are
the result of magic, mutation, breeding, or just natural.

mobs.LongDesc: An albino guard is here, guarding the gates.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This Skaven is huge in comparison to other Skaven you have seen. His fur is
also the purest white. You are not sure whether his skin color and size are
the result of magic, mutation, breeding, or just natural.

mobs.LongDesc: An albino guard is here, guarding the gates.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This Skaven is huge in comparison to other Skaven you have seen. His fur is
also the purest white. You are not sure whether his skin color and size are
the result of magic, mutation, breeding, or just natural.

mobs.LongDesc: An albino guard is here, guarding the gates.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This Skaven is huge in comparison to other Skaven you have seen. His fur is
also the purest white. You are not sure whether his skin color and size are
the result of magic, mutation, breeding, or just natural.

mobs.LongDesc: An albino guard is here, guarding the gates.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This Skaven is huge in comparison to other Skaven you have seen. His fur is
also the purest white. You are not sure whether his skin color and size are
the result of magic, mutation, breeding, or just natural.

mobs.LongDesc: An albino guard is here, guarding the gates.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This Skaven is huge in comparison to other Skaven you have seen. His fur is
also the purest white. You are not sure whether his skin color and size are
the result of magic, mutation, breeding, or just natural.

mobs.LongDesc: An albino guard is here, guarding the gates.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This Skaven is huge in comparison to other Skaven you have seen. His fur is
also the purest white. You are not sure whether his skin color and size are
the result of magic, mutation, breeding, or just natural.

mobs.LongDesc: An albino guard is here, guarding the gates.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
This Skaven is huge in comparison to other Skaven you have seen. His fur is
also the purest white. You are not sure whether his skin color and size are
the result of magic, mutation, breeding, or just natural.

mobs.LongDesc: Grey Seer Thanquol is here, guarding the door.
mobs.DetailedDesc:
Thanquol is a cunning and exceptionally dangerous Grey Seer with a peculiar
gift for avoiding death and inspiring fear in his fellow Skaven. In traditional
Skaven fashion he clawed his way up the order of Grey Seers over the bodies
of his opponents, entering the order as a novice and eventually consuming
his mentor. His rapid rise from the bowels of the Under-City beneath
Skavenblight to the heights of power has been noticed by the Coincil of
Thirteen and it seems he has some patrons, as well as some enemies, amongst
the Lords of Decay.
